intro: Gothofreda selloana, commonly known as the Sello's gothofreda, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, particularly for treating skin conditions and digestive issues. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
